text: Is it possible to write a Chrome Browser Extension that injects the "Developer Mode" Code in the Design Manager URL so that Developer Mode is always enabled, when the  Extension is enabled?
Anyone have an Inbound pass that they’re not using and wouldn’t mind transferring? :grimacing:
Thanks for confirming. I spun my wheels on that one for a minute

<@U034X9K26MD> good day. I hope you are doing well. I have a quick question for you. I am resuming development that uses the automation API ‘/automation/v4/actions/.’ I implemented your advice from our prior conversation and is now able to communicate with the endpoints using oAuth accessToken. Now, i ran into a new problem. When i try reading or writing to that endpoint, i get the error “The account ID provided (#######) isn’t valid. Make sure that account has installed your app before making this call.” The account ID it is referring to, is the one belonging to the developer account. The accessToken i am using was generated when i linked the app to a production account. Any idea?
